description: Requests a description of one or more layers in a specified stack. Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Show, Deploy, or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information about user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

parameters.name: LayerIds
parameters.description: An array of layer IDs that specify the layers to be described. If you omit this parameter, DescribeLayers returns a description of every layer in the specified stack. (string) ---

nested_items.name: Layers
nested_items.description: An array of Layer objects that describe the layers.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of a layer.

nested_items.name: StackId
nested_items.description: The layer stack ID.

nested_items.name: LayerId
nested_items.description: The layer ID.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The layer type.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The layer name. Layer names can be a maximum of 32 characters.

nested_items.name: Shortname
nested_items.description: The layer short name.

nested_items.name: Attributes
nested_items.description: The layer attributes.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogsConfiguration
nested_items.description: The Amazon CloudWatch Logs configuration settings for the layer.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Whether CloudWatch Logs is enabled for a layer.

nested_items.name: LogStreams
nested_items.description: A list of configuration options for CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: LogGroupName
nested_items.description: Specifies the destination log group. A log group is created automatically if it doesn't already exist. Log group names can be between 1 and 512 characters long. Allowed characters include a-z, A-Z, 0-9, --_' (underscore), ---' (hyphen), --/' (forward slash), and --.' (period).

nested_items.name: DatetimeFormat
nested_items.description: Specifies how the time stamp is extracted from logs. For more information, see the CloudWatch Logs Agent Reference.

nested_items.name: TimeZone
nested_items.description: Specifies the time zone of log event time stamps.

nested_items.name: File
nested_items.description: Specifies log files that you want to push to CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: FileFingerprintLines
nested_items.description: Specifies the range of lines for identifying a file. The valid values are one number, or two dash-delimited numbers, such as --1', --2-5'. The default value is --1', meaning the first line is used to calculate the fingerprint. Fingerprint lines are not sent to CloudWatch Logs unless all specified lines are available.

nested_items.name: MultiLineStartPattern
nested_items.description: Specifies the pattern for identifying the start of a log message.

nested_items.name: InitialPosition
nested_items.description: Specifies where to start to read data (start_of_file or end_of_file). The default is start_of_file. This setting is only used if there is no state persisted for that log stream.

nested_items.name: Encoding
nested_items.description: Specifies the encoding of the log file so that the file can be read correctly. The default is utf_8. Encodings supported by Python codecs.decode() can be used here.

nested_items.name: BufferDuration
nested_items.description: Specifies the time duration for the batching of log events. The minimum value is 5000ms and default value is 5000ms.

nested_items.name: BatchCount
nested_items.description: Specifies the max number of log events in a batch, up to 10000. The default value is 1000.

nested_items.name: BatchSize
nested_items.description: Specifies the maximum size of log events in a batch, in bytes, up to 1048576 bytes. The default value is 32768 bytes. This size is calculated as the sum of all event messages in UTF-8, plus 26 bytes for each log event.

nested_items.name: CustomInstanceProfileArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the default IAM profile to be used for the layer's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using Identifiers.

nested_items.name: CustomJson
nested_items.description: A JSON formatted string containing the layer's custom stack configuration and deployment attributes.

nested_items.name: CustomSecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: An array containing the layer's custom security group IDs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DefaultSecurityGroupNames
nested_items.description: An array containing the layer's security group names.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Packages
nested_items.description: An array of Package objects that describe the layer's packages.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: VolumeConfigurations
nested_items.description: A VolumeConfigurations object that describes the layer's Amazon EBS volumes.

nested_items.name: MountPoint
nested_items.description: The volume mount point. For example '/dev/sdh'.

nested_items.name: RaidLevel
nested_items.description: The volume RAID level.

nested_items.name: NumberOfDisks
nested_items.description: The number of disks in the volume.

nested_items.name: Size
nested_items.description: The volume size.

nested_items.name: VolumeType
nested_items.description: The volume type. For more information, see Amazon EBS Volume Types.
standard - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.
io1 - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.
gp2 - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.
st1 - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD). Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 125 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.
sc1 - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 125 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: Specifies whether an Amazon EBS volume is encrypted. For more information, see Amazon EBS Encryption.

nested_items.name: EnableAutoHealing
nested_items.description: Whether auto healing is disabled for the layer.

nested_items.name: AutoAssignElasticIps
nested_items.description: Whether to automatically assign an Elastic IP address to the layer's instances. For more information, see How to Edit a Layer.

nested_items.name: AutoAssignPublicIps
nested_items.description: For stacks that are running in a VPC, whether to automatically assign a public IP address to the layer's instances. For more information, see How to Edit a Layer.

nested_items.name: DefaultRecipes
nested_items.description: OpsWorks Stacks supports five lifecycle events: setup, configuration, deploy, undeploy, and shutdown. For each layer, OpsWorks Stacks runs a set of standard recipes for each event. You can also provide custom recipes for any or all layers and events. OpsWorks Stacks runs custom event recipes after the standard recipes. LayerCustomRecipes specifies the custom recipes for a particular layer to be run in response to each of the five events.

nested_items.name: Setup
nested_items.description: An array of custom recipe names to be run following a setup event.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Configure
nested_items.description: An array of custom recipe names to be run following a configure event.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Deploy
nested_items.description: An array of custom recipe names to be run following a deploy event.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Undeploy
nested_items.description: An array of custom recipe names to be run following a undeploy event.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Shutdown
nested_items.description: An array of custom recipe names to be run following a shutdown event.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CustomRecipes
nested_items.description: A LayerCustomRecipes object that specifies the layer's custom recipes.

nested_items.name: Setup
nested_items.description: An array of custom recipe names to be run following a setup event.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Configure
nested_items.description: An array of custom recipe names to be run following a configure event.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Deploy
nested_items.description: An array of custom recipe names to be run following a deploy event.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Undeploy
nested_items.description: An array of custom recipe names to be run following a undeploy event.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Shutdown
nested_items.description: An array of custom recipe names to be run following a shutdown event.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: Date when the layer was created.

nested_items.name: InstallUpdatesOnBoot
nested_items.description: Whether to install operating system and package updates when the instance boots. The default value is true. If this value is set to false, you must then update your instances manually by using  CreateDeployment to run the update_dependencies stack command or manually running yum (Amazon Linux) or apt-get (Ubuntu) on the instances.

nested_items.name: UseEbsOptimizedInstances
nested_items.description: Whether the layer uses Amazon EBS-optimized instances.

nested_items.name: LifecycleEventConfiguration
nested_items.description: A LifeCycleEventConfiguration object that specifies the Shutdown event configuration.

nested_items.name: ExecutionTimeout
nested_items.description: The time, in seconds, that OpsWorks Stacks waits after triggering a Shutdown event before shutting down an instance.

nested_items.name: DelayUntilElbConnectionsDrained
nested_items.description: Whether to enable Elastic Load Balancing connection draining. For more information, see Connection Draining.
